page.title: 09CRANLEIGH MARKET AND HALL
page.content: { Market } On Thursdays an open air market is held in the car park near the swimming pool. Stalls are arranged in a square. Goods range from haberdashery and fabrics,china and household goods, toys, clothing and stationary. There are also many food stalls. Stall holders travel betweew markets at Crawley, Wimbledon, Guildford, Woking, and Fleet. They carry goods by van or lorry. The fresh fish comes from Hastings. { Village Hall The village hall, part of the war memorial, dates from 1933.A large building with a raked stage, lighting, green-room and kitchen, it is a focus for village life - used continually for exhibitions, concerts, art and craft displays, meetings and private functions.
